intro: Andryala integrifolia var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common watercress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the summer months. Its stems are slender and can grow up to several feet long, often forming dense mats in water. This species is valued for its peppery flavor and is commonly used in salads and culinary applications.
